title: Ethereum Testnet Processes First ETH Staking Withdrawals - CoinDesk
summary: Ethereum's testnet has processed its first ETH staking withdrawals, marking a significant milestone for the ecosystem. The upgrade has sparked excitement and caution among traders, with some predicting increased staking and others forecasting a price drop due to sell pressures.

title: What Is Gwei? - Built In
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Have you heard of "gwei" in relation to the Ethereum Virtual Machine? It's a denomination of Ether (ETH), the fuel used to power transactions on the Ethereum blockchain. Gwei is not the only denomination, but it's the most commonly used for transaction fees. One gwei is equal to 0.000000001 ETH.

To understand gwei, imagine two individuals holding different denominations of currency. Benjamin has a $100 bill, while Abraham has a penny. The difference between their currencies is like the difference between gwei and Ether. Gwei is used to quantify transaction fees, which are necessary to support the operation of the Ethereum network.

Transactions on the Ethereum blockchain can be simple value transfers or complex smart contract operations. In either case, gas fees are needed to cover the expense of operating the network. The gas fees are calculated in gwei, and the price of Ether could change in the future.

In summary,

title: Is Staking Ethereum Really Worth It? - The Motley Fool
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's transition to proof-of-stake (PoS) has made staking less attractive due to the inability to withdraw funds. However, the upcoming Shanghai upgrade will allow users to withdraw their staked funds, making staking more appealing. There are two ways to stake Ethereum: through exchange-provided staking pools or liquid staking protocols. Staking through exchanges is straightforward, while liquid staking protocols offer additional benefits like maintaining liquidity. The annual percentage rate for staking hovers around 4-5%, and the number of validators affects the rate. While the current returns may seem low, consistency over the long run can lead to significant gains. Staking can be thought of as a dividend-paying stock, with the potential for compounding returns.

title: Will You Buy Shiba Inu or Ethereum if You Had $1,000? See What Holders Say - Watcher Guru
summary: In a recent poll, investors were asked whether they would prefer to buy Shiba Inu or Ethereum Classic with $1,000. The majority of respondents (40%) chose Dogecoin, while 34.9% preferred Shiba Inu. Ethereum Classic came in third with 16.7%, and Bitcoin Classic received only 8.1% of the votes. The poll suggests that investors are bullish on Dogecoin and Shiba Inu, considering them affordable and with potential for long-term growth.

title: Lido plans to level up ahead of Ethereum Shanghai hard fork upgrade - Cointelegraph
summary: Lido, a liquid staking protocol, is set to upgrade its platform with the introduction of a new Staking Router and the enablement of liquid staking rewards withdrawals. The upgrade will allow Lido staked ETH (stETH) holders to withdraw funds at a 1:1 ratio in ETH, mitigating risks in the secondary market. The upgrade also includes a withdrawal credential rotation ceremony due to a discrepancy between Lido protocol validators using different signature types. The upgrade is planned for February to April 2023, with development milestones to be tested on the Goerli Testnet before the upgrade itself.

title: Ethereum Name Service DAO Passes Vote to Sell 10K Ether - Yahoo Finance
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

ENS DAO passed a vote to sell 10,000 ETH for USDC to cover operating costs. 89% of participants voted in favor of the proposal. The sale will be conducted on CoW Swap and is expected to bring in at least $13 million. The DAO's treasury holds $67 million in ETH and $2.46 million in USDC. The ENS token is currently trading at $15.69, up 4% in the past 24 hours.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Burn Reaches Levels That Might Start Affecting Price - U.Today
summary: Ethereum's burning rate has increased significantly, with over 10,000 coins destroyed due to the Merge protocol. This could potentially impact the asset's price, as the circulating supply is decreasing at a faster rate. However, the effect on the price may be minimal compared to other factors, such as network revenue and transaction fees. Despite this, the increase in demand and scarcity could contribute to a possible increase in Ethereum's value. The market recovery and growth of the ecosystem are also expected to positively impact the asset's performance.

title: Here’s the First Support for ETH in Case of a Short-Term Correction (Ethereum Price Analysis) - CryptoPotato
summary: Ethereum's uptrend has stalled at $1.7K, with choppy price action and a potential short-term correction on the horizon. Technical analysis suggests that the $1.3K minor support level may be the next stop if Ethereum is rejected at $1.7K. On-chain analysis reveals increased futures market activity, which could lead to a short-term correction and flushing out of highly leveraged long positions.

title: Crypto Protocol Lido Proposes ‘Turbo,’ ‘Bunker’ Modes for Post-Shanghai Ether Withdrawals - CoinDesk
summary: Lido, a crypto protocol, proposes new modes for Ether withdrawals post-Shanghai upgrade. "Turbo" and "Bunker" modes will be tested on Ethereum's Goerli testnet in March, followed by a snapshot vote in the weeks leading up to Shanghai. The v2 upgrade is expected to go live at the end of March or early April.

title: Top Ethereum (ETH) Gas Spenders Are Scammers - U.Today
summary: Top Ethereum gas spenders are scammers, according to PeckShield. Scammers use fake wallet addresses to trick users into sending money, compromising victims' wallets. They create fake wallet histories with zero transfers to look legitimate. Unsuspecting users risk compromising their funds by using scammer addresses without research. Users must be cautious when conducting blockchain transfers, especially on Ethereum, and always check the authenticity of wallet addresses before sending money.

title: DCG sells shares in Grayscale crypto trusts in push to raise funds - Financial Times
summary: Digital Currency Group (DCG), a leading crypto conglomerate, is selling shares in several of its Grayscale investment vehicles at a steep discount in an effort to raise funds. The company is offloading shares in Grayscale's ethereum fund, with a goal of raising up to $22 million. The shares are being sold at $8 per share, despite each share's claim to $16 of ether. This move comes as DCG faces financial difficulties and seeks to repay over $3 billion in debts to its creditors. The company has also been embroiled in a public dispute with Gemini exchange over the debts. Despite the discounted sales, Grayscale's assets continue to generate significant fees, with the company earning $303 million in fees from its bitcoin trust in the first nine months of 2022.

title: DCG Dumps ETH Trust Shares Despite Steep Discount: Report - Blockworks
summary: Digital Currency Group (DCG) has sold shares of some of Grayscale Investments' crypto trusts to raise capital following the bankruptcy filing of Genesis, a subsidiary. DCG has sold a quarter of its shares in the Grayscale Ethereum Trust (ETHE), raising $22 million, and a smaller number of shares in other trusts with combined assets under management of $700 million. The sale comes after Genesis filed for bankruptcy and DCG is looking to raise cash. The move highlights the need for a redemption window for ETHE shares, which are trading at a steep discount. Grayscale has also sued the SEC to convert its Bitcoin Trust (GBTC) into an ETF, which could help close the trust's discount.

title: Ethereum’s future hinges on validators amidst declining interest and market trends - AMBCrypto News
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's future hinges on validators, despite declining interest and market trends. Validator numbers remained steady despite bear market, with 218,068 new validators added in 2022. Positive developments such as Shanghai Upgrade and Visa's partnership could improve Ethereum's odds of success. Despite decreased whale interest and network growth, the number of validators continued to grow, indicating a promising future.

title: 3 High-Growth Coins That Could Be Worth $1 Trillion by 2030 - The Motley Fool
summary:
Three high-growth coins with potential to reach a trillion-dollar valuation by 2030:

1. Bitcoin (BTC): Has the potential to double in value to reach a trillion-dollar valuation, based on current price and market cap.
2. Ethereum (ETH): Would need to grow fivefold to reach a trillion-dollar valuation, with growth potential from its various business lines, including NFTs, gaming, DeFi, and the metaverse.
3. Solana (SOL): Has the potential for 100X returns, but faces significant challenges from a financial modeling perspective. Its mobile crypto initiative and global expansion strategy could help drive growth.

Long-term view of crypto: It may take nearly a decade for multiple cryptos to reach a trillion-dollar valuation, with Bitcoin and Ethereum being potential options for long-term investment.

title: DeFi's Next Big Thing: Liquid Staking Derivatives - Cointelegraph
summary:
DeFi's Next Big Thing: Liquid Staking Derivatives

Liquid staking derivatives (LSDs) have gained popularity in recent months, leading to a surge in cash flow in DeFi. LSDs are a relatively new type of token that enables stakers to augment potential returns by unlocking liquidity for their staked cryptocurrency, such as ETH.

LSDs have already made a significant impact in DeFi, accounting for over 20% of the entire TVL across liquid staking protocols. The dominance of Lido, the largest liquid staking protocol, is over 17% of DeFi's TVL as of February 2023.

LSDs stimulate DeFi activity by allowing stakers to multiply the benefits from their locked tokens. Stakers can use LSD tokens in the broader DeFi market to leverage yield opportunities, such as lending platforms, or use them as collateral to borrow assets for further market activities.

title: Bullish: Shiba Inu Becomes Largest Token Holding Among Top Ethereum Whales | Bitcoinist.com - Bitcoinist
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Shiba Inu (SHIB) has regained its position as the largest token holding among top Ethereum whales, with over 50.5 trillion SHIB worth $708.4 million, accounting for 17.82% of their total value holding. This is ahead of stablecoins USDT and USDC, which make up 17.35% and 14.46% of their holdings, respectively. The renewed interest from investors has driven SHIB's price up 19% over the past week, and it's currently trading at a three-month high. However, the token's price has declined 2.74% in the past 24 hours ahead of Fed Chair Jerome Powell's speech, which could trigger volatility in the market.

title: Crypto donations to Turkey surpass $2m as rock star's fundraiser green-lit by govt - DLNews
summary: Crypto donations to Turkey have surpassed $2 million following a devastating earthquake in the southeast of the country. The push for crypto donations gained momentum after well-connected Turkish rock star Haluk Levent personally took the matter to the government. Levent received approval to accept crypto donations for one week after consulting with the government's financial watchdog. The crypto wallet addresses set up in various blockchains, including Ethereum and Binance Smart Chain, received over $2 million in various cryptocurrencies within a few hours of Levent's announcement. The donations are tax-efficient and fast, allowing for near-instant transfers from anywhere. The death toll from the earthquake has risen to nearly 5,000, with more casualties expected as search and rescue efforts continue.

title: Despite TRON dominating Ethereum, new challenges emerge for TRX - AMBCrypto News
summary: Despite TRON's recent success in stablecoin dominance, the network is facing new challenges. TRX's volume has decreased, and the number of stakers and active accounts has also seen a decline. These factors could negatively impact the network's liquidity and future stability. However, it remains to be seen how TRON will fare in the face of these challenges.

summary: Ethereum price prediction: Bullish triangle pattern still valid, targeting $1,848. ETH price struggling to break through $1,690 resistance, but bullish breakout expected soon. Watch key levels in 4-hour timeframe.

title: Rabby Wallet, Your Alternative Ethereum-Compatible Wallet - Altcoin Buzz
summary:
Rabby Wallet is an Ethereum-compatible, non-custodial wallet that offers several features that set it apart from other wallets. Here are the main points from the article:

1. Rabby Wallet is developed by DeBank, a Chinese company that raised $25 million in funding.
2. The wallet connects to 44 chains and automatically switches to the correct chain, eliminating the need for manual switching.
3. Rabby Wallet shows users exactly what they sign, reducing the risk of signing transactions they don't understand.
4. The wallet screens each transaction before signing, warning users of potential risks and security threats.
5. Rabby Wallet is well-organized and easy to navigate, with a dedicated NFT section that shows all Ethereum and Polygon NFTs owned by the user.
6. The wallet is available as a Chrome and Brave extension and will soon be available on Firefox and Edge.
7. Users can import their MetaMask or Trust Wallet addresses and set up a new Rabby address.
8. Rabby Wallet offers a well-organized NFT section that

title: 'Multichain future is very clear' — MetaMask to support all tokens via Snaps - Cointelegraph
summary: MetaMask, a popular Ethereum-based wallet service, is expanding its ecosystem with the development of Snaps, a system that allows developers to extend the capabilities of the wallet extension. Snaps will enable interoperability with non-native blockchains and tokens, allowing users to interact with a broader range of blockchain-based protocols from within the MetaMask wallet. This will create a "multichain future" for MetaMask and improve Web3 functionality by addressing issues such as transaction signing safety. Snaps are currently available in the developer version of MetaMask Flask, with integration with the main MetaMask planned for the end of 2023.

title: Scammers are targeting crypto users with new 'zero value TransferFrom' trick - Cointelegraph
summary: Scammers are targeting crypto users with a new trick called the "zero value TransferFrom" scam. The attackers send a transaction of zero value from the victim's wallet to a lookalike address, potentially causing the victim to accidentally send tokens to the attacker. The scam exploits a loophole in some token contracts that allow anyone to send a transaction from another person's wallet without their permission, as long as the amount is less than or equal to the allowed amount. To avoid falling victim to this scam, crypto users are advised to exercise caution and verify the address before executing any transactions, utilize the whitelist feature in their wallet, stay vigilant and informed, and maintain a healthy level of skepticism.

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Falter; Big Eyes Coin Extends Launch Offer, Makes $23m At Presale - Analytics Insight
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin and Ethereum declined over the weekend, with Bitcoin losing 4% of its value and Ethereum dropping by 2%. Despite the market downturn, Big Eyes Coin (BIG) made an impressive $23m in presale and extended its 200% launch bonus. The token has been performing exceptionally well in the presale and is expected to go live soon. Investors are optimistic about BIG's future, with many benefiting from the 200% bonus.
